value.name: Boyfriend pleads guilty in stabbing death of girlfriend in Wilson County
value.description: Christopher Clark has pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in the death of a Lebanon woman who was stabbed multiple times in 2018. Ariel Warden, 25, was Clark's girlfriend and the couple had three children together according to the district attorney's office.

value.name: Clark pleads guilty in 2018 homicide
value.description: Nearly three years after his arrest on a first-degree murder charge, Christopher Clark pleaded guilty to a lesser crime this week.

value.name: Since George Floyd’s death, 17 people have died during police encounters in N.J.
value.description: Two days before the world knew who George Floyd was, Maurice Gordon was driving southbound on the Garden State Parkway in a black Honda Civic. He had left his hometown of Poughkeepsie, New York, and wasn’t acting like himself,

value.name: Lumberton man arrested in connection with thefts from Smithfield Foods employee lockers
value.description: ELIZABETHTOWN — A 24-year-old Lumberton man was arrested Tuesday for breaking into employee lockers at Smithfield Foods.

value.name: Students get valuable experience responding to simulated crash at RCC
value.description: Emergency Medical Science students at Robeson Community College gained valuable real-world training Thursday during a vehicle crash.

value.name: Columbus police trail only Chicago in fatal shootings of juveniles since 2013
value.description: Since 2013, when Mapping Police Violence statistics began, only Chicago police have fatally shot more juveniles than Columbus police.

value.name: Police Chief Ousted In Harvey; Many Shocked
value.description: Harvey Mayor Christopher Clark calls it all a 'non-story,' but former Chief Eddie Winters connects it to his choice not to promote three officers he says were handpicked by the mayor. CBS 2's ...

value.name: Harvey Mayor Bans Police Chokeholds, Other Similar Maneuvers
value.description: Harvey Mayor Christopher Clark has signed a new directive aimed at preventing deaths in police custody. Clark’s order bans the use of chokeholds and similar police tactics.
